result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien R Georgeson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

to District Attorney
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Damien R Georgeson in court with attorney Richard L Yonko.  Defendant Damien R Georgeson in custody.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests waiver of PSI. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty. The Court finds Defendant's plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the Defendant guilty. Defendant waives PSI. Court accepts waiver of PSI. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement. 

Court orders: 
3 yrs 2 months in the WI State Prison System - Dodge Correctional is designated as reception center
1 yr 2 months - initial confinement
2 yrs 0 months - extended supervision

Defendant is not eligible for challenge incarceration program but is eligible for the substance abuse program.
